designSystem.name: Analog CRT Monitor Design System
designSystem.description: A complete design system inspired by vintage CRT monitors, featuring monochrome glowing displays, pixelated typography, scanlines, and a retro-futuristic terminal aesthetic. This system transforms the entire application into a nostalgic computing experience while maintaining full functionality.

corePrinciples: CRT Authenticity - Every element should feel like it's displayed on a physical CRT monitor
Monochrome Glow - Single color schemes (amber, orange, yellow, green) with glowing effects on dark backgrounds
Visible Pixelation - Embrace low-resolution, blocky, pixelated aesthetics throughout
Scanline Texture - Horizontal scanlines and visible pixel grids create depth and authenticity
Terminal Minimalism - Clean, text-heavy interfaces with monospace fonts and command-line aesthetics
Chunky Geometry - Blocky, thick-bordered UI elements with minimal curves
Data Visualization - Retro-styled charts, graphs, and progress indicators
System Feedback - Error states, loading states, and system messages feel like terminal output
Glowing Typography - Text emits a soft glow, especially in dark areas
Retro Futurism - Nostalgic computing aesthetic with modern functionality
designPhilosophy.aesthetic: Vintage CRT monitor display (circa 1980s-1990s) with monochrome phosphor glow
designPhilosophy.mood: Nostalgic, technical, authentic, retro-futuristic, terminal-like, data-driven
designPhilosophy.era: Early computing era - think TRS-80, Apple II, Commodore 64, early Macintosh terminals

usageGuidelines.primaryScheme: Choose one monochrome scheme (amber, orange, yellow, green, or cyan) as the primary color for the entire interface
usageGuidelines.accentScheme: Use a different monochrome scheme for accents, data visualizations, or special states
usageGuidelines.background: Always use dark backgrounds (#0A0A0A to #1A1A1A) to create the CRT screen effect
usageGuidelines.contrast: Ensure high contrast between text/UI elements and background for readability
usageGuidelines.glow: Apply subtle glow effects to all text and interactive elements to simulate phosphor glow

display.name: Blocky, pixelated display font
display.description: Large headings, titles, and prominent text use pixelated/blocky fonts
display.fallback: Monospaced font with letter-spacing adjustments to create blocky effect

data.name: Monospaced numeric font

sm.usage: Secondary text, track labels, minor UI elements

base.usage: Body text, default text size, standard UI elements

xxl.usage: Large headings, display text, major titles

display.usage: Hero text, major display elements, system messages

fontWeights.bold: 700 - Major headings, window titles, critical information

scanlineOverlay.description: Text should appear to have scanlines passing over it
scanlineOverlay.implementation: Overlay subtle horizontal lines or use scanline texture on text containers

glow.usage: Apply to all text, buttons, inputs, and interactive elements

guidelines.chunky: Use larger spacing than typical - elements should feel blocky and separated

glow.description: Borders should have a subtle glow effect

contrast.minimum: WCAG AA compliant - ensure high contrast between monochrome colors and dark background
contrast.textOnBackground: Primary monochrome color on dark background (#0A0A0A) provides excellent contrast
contrast.focusIndicators: Strong glow and thick borders provide clear focus indication

keyboard.navigation: Full keyboard support - all interactive elements keyboard accessible
keyboard.shortcuts: Standard OS shortcuts plus application-specific shortcuts
keyboard.focusManagement: Logical tab order, visible focus indicators with strong glow

screenReaders.labels: All interactive elements have accessible labels
screenReaders.note: Visual design should not rely solely on color - use icons, borders, and text as well

swiftui.colors: Use Color(hex:) extension or NSColor for custom monochrome colors
swiftui.glow: Use .shadow() modifier with blur radius and matching color for glow effects
swiftui.scanlines: Use overlay with repeating gradient or texture image for scanline effect
swiftui.borders: Use .overlay() with Rectangle and .stroke() for thick, blocky borders
swiftui.fonts: Use .monospaced() modifier or specify monospaced font family
swiftui.pixelation: Use integer pixel sizes, avoid anti-aliasing where possible
swiftui.textEffects: Combine .shadow() for glow with letter spacing for blocky effect

consistency.colorScheme: Choose one primary monochrome scheme and use consistently throughout
consistency.typography: Use monospaced fonts throughout, maintain consistent sizes
consistency.glow: Apply glow effects consistently - all text and interactive elements should glow
consistency.borders: Use thick, blocky borders consistently - avoid rounded corners
consistency.scanlines: Apply scanline overlay to all major content areas

performance.glow: Glow effects (shadows) can be performance-intensive - use sparingly on large lists
performance.scanlines: Scanline overlays should be lightweight - use CSS gradients or simple textures
performance.rendering: Optimize for smooth interactions despite visual effects

authenticity.pixelation: Embrace pixelation - don't try to make everything smooth
authenticity.blocky: Use blocky, chunky elements - avoid smooth curves and rounded corners
authenticity.glow: Glow effects are essential - they create the CRT phosphor effect
authenticity.scanlines: Scanlines add authenticity - apply to all screen areas
authenticity.monochrome: Stick to monochrome color schemes - avoid mixing too many colors
authenticity.terminal: Think terminal/command-line aesthetic - functional, text-heavy, data-driven

designPrinciples.authenticity: Every element should feel like it's displayed on a real CRT monitor from the 1980s-1990s
designPrinciples.monochrome: Stick to single color schemes - don't mix too many colors
designPrinciples.glow: Glow effects are essential - they create the CRT phosphor aesthetic
designPrinciples.blocky: Use chunky, blocky elements - avoid smooth curves
designPrinciples.functional: Maintain full functionality despite the retro aesthetic
designPrinciples.readable: Ensure text is always readable with high contrast
designPrinciples.consistent: Apply design principles consistently throughout the application
designPrinciples.nostalgic: Evoke nostalgia for early computing while remaining modern and functional
